intro: Lacis bongardii, commonly known as the Bongard's lac plant, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Its latex sap has been used traditionally for various purposes, including as a natural adhesive.
